client.net
Interface NetworkingOut

All Known Implementing Classes:
ClientConnection
public interface NetworkingOut

This will list all of the functions which the UI code expects the networking code to implement, as part of the networking protocol. Although the server's response is out of the scope of this aspect, it will be indicated in the documentation descriptively how the server will respond, as is considered helpful.

Author:
James McMinn, Gordon Martin

Method Detail

ping

void ping()
used to implement the "keep-alive" command. Sends a ping to the server to check if the client is still "alive"

serverstatus

void serverstatus()
sends a request to the server to return (as a line): the number of users online the time, the uptime of the server

servernumberofusers

void servernumberofusers()
sends a request to the server to the number of users logged in

serverTime

void serverTime()
sends a request to the server to return the server's time

serverUptime

void serverUptime()
sends a request to the server to the server to return the uptime of the server

authenticate

void authenticate(java.lang.String emailaddress,
                  java.lang.String password)
sends a request to the server to log in

Parameters:
emailaddress - a valid e-mail address
password - the password corresponding to the e-mail address The server will return the user's authorisation state: logged in, or unauthorised

register

void register(java.lang.String emailaddress,
              java.lang.String password)
sends a request to the server to register an account

Parameters:
emailaddress - the desired e-mail address
password - the desired password If the registration is unsuccessful, the server will respond with an error message indicating why

quit

void quit()
sends a request to the server to log the user out. If handled successfully, the connection will be terminated from the server.

setNickname

void setNickname(java.lang.String nickname)
Sends a request to the server to set the user's nickname

Parameters:
nickname - The desired nickname

createGroupChat

void createGroupChat(java.lang.Boolean publicchat)
Sends a request to the server to create a new group chat

Parameters:
publicchat - if true, then any user has permission to join if false, only those invited to the chat has permission to join
